oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fifty Dollar Reward for the Capture of Hiram Brown
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Reward poster issued by A. J. Tipton, Sheriff of Carter County, for the capture of Hiram Brown, wanted for the first degree killing of Wilson Mattox. Brown broke out of the Carter County Jail on July 25, 1848. The poster claims the governor will offer an additional reward of two hundred dollars or more. It also provides a description of Brown's physical and personality characteristics.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; Crime; Law Enforcement
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: A. J. Tipton
